intro: Psychotria perpapillifera, commonly known as the papillate Psychotria, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent papillae on the underside, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Psychotria perpapillifera is often found in humid, shaded understory environments of tropical rainforests.
